scam-card1.paragraph: Scammers pose as Police or CBI on video calls, saying you are arrested and must stay on camera for hours. Fact: Police never arrest anyone over video call.

scam-card2.paragraph: You might get a call that sounds 100% like your grandchild crying for help. Scammers use AI to copy their voice. Tip: Always call them back on their real number first.

scam-card3.paragraph: An SMS says Your power will be cut tonight at 9 PM due to unpaid bills. It asks you to call a number. Reality:Real bill departments never send personal phone numbers in SMS.

scam-card4.paragraph: Claims your ATM card is blocked and asks for an OTP. Real banks will never ask for your OTP or PIN over the phone.

scam-card5.paragraph: Someone says a parcel in your name contains illegal items and you must pay to clear it. Just hang up—it's a scam to scare you.

scam-card6.paragraph: WhatsApp messages saying you've won ₹25 Lakhs. They ask for a small processing fee first. Once you pay, they disappear.

report-section.paragraph: Don't wait. Call the National Cybercrime Helpline immediately.
